Summary I retired from Intel in December 2013, and enjoyed a 60 days of sabbatical like vacation in which Susan and I traveled, did some sightseeing and I got to pay some golf along the way 
 
Starting in March, as an Social Venture Partners Encore Fellow, I have been assisting a local non-profit scale their operation. In that process, I have be working with the CEO of the Jessie F. Richardson Foundation (JFRF) to help them scale their operations to reach more areas, currently they are working in Nicaragua and Appalachia.  
 
JFRF has a unique model to bring together community resources to identify, engage and deploy a multi-generational sustainable network of assets to support under-served older adults.  
My role in working with CEO involves clarifying and capturing operationally the key elements of the JFRF asset based model, as well as identify potential income steams for the community partners as well as the Jessie F Richardson Foundation. In this process of finding ways to scale JFRFs operationally, a number of ways have been identified to bring together existing mobile technologies to help support the local community partnerships engagements as well as assisting in JFRF rolling out their first crowd-funding campaign. JFRF’s CEO is very entrepreneurial, thus this engagement has a start-up-like feel to it, which makes it great fun. 
 
One of my bucket items has been to improve my golf game...to become a bogie golfer. My work with JFRF has allowed me time to make progress on this item, and the weather this summer has as equally accommodating.
